service.tut.pori.apilta.alerts.datatypes

Class LocationParameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.tut.pori.http.parameters.HTTPParameter
      • service.tut.pori.apilta.alerts.datatypes.LocationParameter

  • public class LocationParameter
extends core.tut.pori.http.parameters.HTTPParameter
    The default parser for location parameters. The syntax being: ?location=LOCATION_PARAMETERLOCATION_VALUELOCATION_PARAMETERLOCATION_VALUE Possible LOCATION_PARAMETERs and corresponding LOCATION_VALUEs:
    • "coordinate" and "latitude longitude". The datum for the coordinate depends on the service, but both latitude and longitude must be in numeric (Java double) format with decimal separator being period (.). Latitude and longitude must be separated by white space.
    • "heading" and "heading_value". Heading value (generally, in degrees) must be a double with period (.) as decimal separator.
    For example, the location: ?location=coordinate0 0heading0 would be location in coordinate 0.0 and the heading would be 0 The parser does not validate the given values, remember to check the returned getValue() object with Location.isValid(Location). Especially, the presence of heading value without coordinate values should be checked by the implementing service if checks are required. If multiple values are given, the output is unspecified (most likely, the last value given in the query URL will be used for initialization).
